00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Cost matrix transformation functions.
00003  *
00004  * Cost matrix transformation functions for the bottleneck traveling salesman
00005  * problem (BTSP).
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "btsp.h"
00012 
00013 /****************************************************************************
00014  * Private structures
00015  ****************************************************************************/
00016 typedef struct fun_data
00017 {
00018     arrow_btsp_fun *fun;            /**< cost matrix function */
00019     arrow_problem *base_problem;    /**< base problem for function */
00020     int delta;                      /**< delta parameter */
00021 } fun_data;
00022 
00023 
00024 /****************************************************************************
00025  * Private function prototypes
00026  ****************************************************************************/
00027 /**
00028  *  @brief  Creates a shallow data structure with data applied with given
00029  *          cost matrix function and some base problem.
00030  *  @param  fun [in] the cost matrix function
00031  *  @param  old_problem [in] the base problem
00032  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00033  *  @param  new_problem [out] the newly created, "shallow" problem
00034  */
00035 int
00036 apply_shallow(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00037               int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00038 
00039 /**
00040  *  @brief  Creates a deep data structure with data applied with given
00041  *          cost matrix function and some base problem.
00042  *  @param  fun [in] the cost matrix function
00043  *  @param  old_problem [in] the base problem
00044  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00045  *  @param  new_problem [out] the newly created, "deep" problem
00046  */
00047 int
00048 apply_deep(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00049            int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00050 
00051 /**
00052  *  @brief  Cost function for problems based upon cost matrix functions.
00053  *  @param  this [in] problem structure
00054  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00055  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00056  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00057  */
00058 int 
00059 fun_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j);
00060 
00061 /**
00062  *  @brief  Destructs problem based upon cost matrix functions.
00063  *  @param  this [in] problem structure
00064  */
00065 void 
00066 fun_destruct(arrow_problem *this);
00067 
00068 /**
00069  *  @brief  Cost function for problems based upon Concorde's data structure.
00070  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00071  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00072  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00073  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00074  */
00075 int 
00076 cc_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j);
00077 
00078 /**
00079  *  @brief  Destructs problems based upon Concorde's data structure
00080  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00081  */
00082 void
00083 cc_destruct(arrow_problem *problem);

00085 
00086 /****************************************************************************
00087  * Public function implementations
00088  ****************************************************************************/
00089 int
00090 arrow_btsp_fun_apply(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00091                      int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00092 {
00093     new_problem->size = old_problem->size;
00094     new_problem->symmetric = old_problem->symmetric;
00095     new_problem->shallow = fun->shallow;
00096     strcpy(new_problem->name, old_problem->name);
00097     
00098     if(!fun->initialize(fun))
00099     {
00100         arrow_print_error("Error initializing cost matrix function.");
00101         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00102     }
00103     
00104     if(fun->shallow)
00105         return apply_shallow(fun, old_problem, delta, new_problem);
00106     else
00107         return apply_deep(fun, old_problem, delta, new_problem);
00108 }
00109 
00110 void
00111 arrow_btsp_fun_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00112 {
00113     fun->destruct(fun);
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 /****************************************************************************
00118  * Private function implementations
00119  ****************************************************************************/
00120 int
00121 apply_shallow(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00122               int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00123 {
00124     fun_data *data = NULL;
00125     if((data = malloc(sizeof(fun_data))) == NULL)
00126     {
00127         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for fun_data");
00128         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00129     }
00130     
00131     data->fun = fun;
00132     data->base_problem = old_problem;
00133     data->delta = delta;
00134     
00135     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_BTSP_FUN;
00136     new_problem->data = (void *)data;
00137     new_problem->get_cost = fun_get_cost;
00138     new_problem->destruct = fun_destruct;
00139     
00140     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00141 }
00142 
00143 int
00144 apply_deep(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00145            int delta, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00146 {
00147     int i, j;
00148     int size = old_problem->size;    
00149     
00150     CCdatagroup *dat = NULL;
00151     if((dat = malloc(sizeof(CCdatagroup))) == NULL)
00152     {
00153         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for CCdatagroup");
00154         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00155     }
00156     
00157     if(!arrow_util_CCdatagroup_init_matrix(size, dat))
00158     {
00159         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for CC matrix");
00160         free(dat);
00161         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00162     }
00163     
00164     for(i = 0; i < size; i++)
00165     {
00166         for(j = 0; j < i; j++)
00167             dat->adj[i][j] = fun->get_cost(fun, old_problem, delta, i, j);
00168     }
00169     
00170     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_CONCORDE;
00171     new_problem->data = (void *)dat;
00172     new_problem->get_cost = cc_get_cost;
00173     new_problem->destruct = cc_destruct;
00174 
00175     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00176 }
00177 
00178 int 
00179 fun_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j)
00180 {
00181     fun_data *d = (fun_data *)(this->data);
00182     return d->fun->get_cost(d->fun, d->base_problem, d->delta, i, j);
00183 }
00184 
00185 void 
00186 fun_destruct(arrow_problem *this)
00187 { }
00188 
00189 int 
00190 cc_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00191 {
00192     CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;    
00193     return dat->edgelen(i, j, dat);
00194 }
00195 
00196 void
00197 cc_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00198 {    
00199     if(problem->data != NULL)
00200     {
00201         CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;
00202         CCutil_freedatagroup(dat);
00203     }
00204 }
